requirements: Given statements should establish context for the scenario.
feedback: Ensure Given steps are focused on preconditions that exist before the scenario begins.

valid: Given there exists a section with an active waitlist (Uses recommended structure and past tense)
Given the student has added the section to the cart (Uses recommended structure and past perfect tense)

invalid.example: Given a section that is accepting wait list students
invalid.suggestion: Given there exists a section with an active waitlist

invalid.example: Given the student adds a section to the cart
invalid.suggestion: Given the student has added the section to the cart

requirements: When steps should describe a single action or behavior.
feedback: Ensure When steps are focused on actions being taken in the current context.

valid: When the student purchases the section by deposit (Uses recommended structure and present tense)
When the user submits the form (Uses recommended structure and present tense)

invalid.example: When a student will purchase a section by deposit
invalid.suggestion: When the student purchases the section by deposit

invalid.example: When the student navigates to the section profile and adds the section to the cart
invalid.suggestion: When the student adds the section to the cart

structure: the validation error message for <action outcome> <validation condition>
requirements: Then steps should focus on the expected outcome or result.
feedback: Ensure Then steps describe the resulting state or change caused by the action.

valid: Then the purchase is successful (Uses recommended structure and refers to action from When)
Then the student is enrolled in the section (Uses recommended structure and refers to entity from Given)
Then the validation error message for section not available is displayed (Uses recommended structure and present tense)

invalid.example: Then the enrollment to the section is successful
And the section has a new student
invalid.suggestion: And the student is enrolled in the section
